direction.raw_text: NIGHT - TITLE SEQUENCE A series of traveling shots. A well-dressed, pompous-looking individual (JOHN DASHWOOD, 35) is making an urgent journey on horseback. He looks anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MARCH 1800 - NIGHT Silence. Norland Park, a large country house built in the early part of the eighteenth century, lies in the moonlit parkland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the dim light shed by candles we see a bed in which a MAN (MR DASHWOOD, 52) lies his skin waxy, his breathing laboured. Around him two silhouettes move and murmur, their clothing susurrating in the deathly hush. DOCTORS. A WOMAN (MRS DASHWOOD, 50) sits by his side, holding his hand, her eyes never leaving his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent) Is John not yet arrived?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We expect him at any moment, dearest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks anguished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They smile at each other. MRS DASHWOOD is just managing to conceal her fear and grief
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The girls--I have left so little.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shh, hush, Henry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elinor will try to look after you all, but make sure she finds a good husband. The men are such noodles hereabouts, little wonder none has pleased her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But Marianne is sure to find her storybook hero.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A romantic poet with flashing eyes and empty pockets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As long as she loves him, whoever he is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret will go to sea and become a pirate so we need not concern ourselves with her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tries to laugh but it emerges as a sob. An older MANSERVANT (THOMAS) now enters, anxiety written on every feature.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your son is arrived from London, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: squeezes his wife's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods quickly and he smiles at her with infinite tenderness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let me speak to John alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, my dear. How happy you have made me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: makes a superhuman effort and smiles back. She allows THOMAS to help her out. She passes JOHN DASHWOOD as he enters, presses his hand, but cannot speak. JOHN takes her place by the bed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Father...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: summons his last ounces of energy and starts to whisper with desperate intensity.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: John you will find out soon enough from my will that the estate of Norland was left to me in such a way as prevents me from dividing it between my families.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: blinks. He cannot quite take it in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But MR DASHWOOD continues with even greater determination.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Calm yourself, Father. This is not good for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Norland in its entirety is therefore yours by law and I am happy for you and Fanny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks torn between genuine distress and unexpected delight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JOHN's face is a picture of conflicting emotions. Behind them is the ominous rustling of parchments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brief moment of sincerity overcomes JOHN's natural hypocrisy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But your stepmother my wife and daughters are left with only five hundred pounds a year, barely enough to live on and nothing for the girls' dowries. You must help them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must promise to do this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise, Father, I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: seems relieved. Suddenly his breathing changes. JOHN looks alarmed. He rises and we hear him going to find the DOCTOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it is we who share the dying man's last words.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come! Come quickly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Outside the house sits a very well-to-do carriage. Behind it waits another open carriage upon which servants are laying trunks and boxes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) 'Help them?'
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is standing in mourning clothes and a traveling cape. He is watching, and obviously waiting for, a pert WOMAN (FANNY DASHWOOD) who is standing by a mirror looking at him keenly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, 'help them'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dearest, I mean to give them three thousand pounds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: goes very still. JOHN gets nervous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The interest will provide them with a little extra income. Such a gift will certainly discharge my promise to my father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: slowly turns back to the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause as FANNY turns and looks at him again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, without question! More than amply...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One had rather, on such occasions, do too much than too little.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course, he did not stipulate a particular sum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A red-eyed MAID (BETSY) plunges a beautiful muslin frock into a vat of black dye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is rushing about, mourning ribbons flapping, putting her knick-knacks into a small valise. The room is in chaos. A young WOMAN (ELINOR DASHWOOD) looks on helplessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She suddenly collapses into a chair and bursts into tears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To be reduced to the condition of visitor in my own home! It is not to be borne, Elinor!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Consider, Mamma! We have nowhere to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John and Fanny will descend from London at any moment, followed no doubt by cartloads of relatives ready to turn us out of our rooms one by one do you expect me to be here to welcome them? Vultures!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shall start making inquiries for a new house at once. Until then we must try to bear their coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and FANNY are on their way out of London.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fifteen hundred then. What say you to fifteen hundred?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What brother on earth would do half so much for his real sisters--let alone half-blood?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They can hardly expect more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is no knowing what they expect. The question is, what can you afford?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A beautiful young WOMAN (MARIANNE DASHWOOD) is sitting at the piano playing a particularly sad piece. ELINOR enters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne, cannot you play something else? Mamma has been weeping since breakfast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stops, turns the pages of her music book and starts playing something equally lugubrious.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I meant something less mournful, dearest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and FANNY are waiting as the OSTLERS make the final adjustments to their carriage. The LANDLORD hovers, waiting for a tip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He displays some coins in his hand. FANNY removes one and nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A hundred pounds a year to their mother while she lives. Would that be more advisable? It is better than parting with the fifteen hundred all at once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But if she should live longer than fifteen years we would be completely taken in. People always live forever when there is an annuity to be paid them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gives the coins to the LANDLORD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes to the foot of a large tree from which a small staircase issues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause. ELINOR is about to leave when a disembodied and truculent young voice stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. ELINOR tries another tack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret, are you there? Please come down. John and Fanny will be here soon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Why are they coming to live at Norland? They already have a house in London.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because houses go from father to son, dearest not from father to daughter. It is the law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you come inside, we could play with your atlas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It's not my atlas any more. It's their atlas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on ELINOR as she ponders the truth of this statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and FANNY joggle on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty pounds now and then will amply discharge my promise, you are quite right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed. Although to say the truth, I am convinced within myself that your father had no idea of your giving them money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They will have five hundred a year amongst them as it is--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --and what on earth can four women want for more than that? Their housekeeping will be nothing at all they will have no carriage, no horses, hardly any servants and will keep no company. Only conceive how comfortable they will be!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The large contingent of SERVANTS who staff Norland Park are gathered in gloomy silence as ELINOR addresses them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: As you know, we are looking for a new home. When we leave we shall be able to retain only Thomas and Betsy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: holds on THOMAS and BETSY, a capable woman.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are very sorry to have to leave you all. But we are certain you will find the new Mrs Dashwood a fair and generous mistress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DRIVE - DAY JOHN and FANNY's carriage approaches Norland.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They will be much more able to give you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and FANNY are about to get out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So we are agreed. No money but the occasional gift of game and fish in season will be very welcome.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your father would be proud of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The entire family, with the exception of MARGARET, is present. BETSY is serving food in an atmosphere of stiff silence. Cutlery clinks. JOHN chews loudly. MARIANNE is rigid with resentment. MRS DASHWOOD maintains a cool, removed dignity. ELINOR tries to play hostess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the brief silence which follows this, FANNY surreptitiously checks the hallmark on her butterknife.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How is Mrs Ferrars?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My mother is always in excellent health, thank you. My brother Robert is in town with her this season and quite the most popular bachelor in London! He has his own barouche.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have two brothers, have you not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed, yes. Edward is the eldest Mamma quite depends upon him. He is traveling up from Plymouth shortly and will break his journey here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at ELINOR pointedly. JOHN notices.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to MRS DASHWOOD) If that is agreeable to you, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dear John this is your home now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks about, barely able to conceal her satisfaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sitting with a little pile of parcels. She puts a shawl into some paper and ties it with ribbon as MARIANNE thunders in, looking mutinous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fanny wishes to know where the key for the silver cabinet is kept.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Betsy has it, I think. What does Fanny want with the silver?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can only presume she wants to count it. What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Presents for the servants. Have you seen Margaret? I am worried about her. She has taken to hiding in the oddest places.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fortunate girl. At least she can escape Fanny, which is more than any of us is able.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do your best. You have not said a word to her for a week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (truculently) I have! I have said 'yes' and 'no'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and JOHN are at breakfast. MARIANNE enters. ELINOR catches her eye and indicates FANNY with a slight motion of her head. MARIANNE makes a face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (very polite) Good morning, Fanny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is rather startled.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is relieved.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Fanny) How did you find the silver? Is it all genuine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rushes in before MARIANNE gets any further.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pray, when may we expect the pleasure of your brother's company?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Edward is due tomorrow. And my dear Mrs Dashwood, in view of the fact that he will not be with us for long, I wondered if Miss Margaret would mind giving up her room to him the view is quite incomparable from her windows and I should so much like Edward to see Norland at its best.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: slams her cup down and throws a furious look at ELINOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MARIANNE are removing MARGARET's toys.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Intolerable woman!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is but one consolation if Edward is anything like Fanny, we shall be only too happy to leave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A very capable HORSEMAN (EDWARD FERRARS) canters up the gravel drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on his face as he gazes up at the elegant facade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone except MARGARET is present. EDWARD has just shaken bands with ELINOR. He behaves with great respect to the DASHWOODS and seems embarrassed by FANNY's pro prietorial air.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But where is Miss Margaret? I declare, Mrs Dashwood, I am beginning to doubt of her existence! She must run positively wild!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive us, Mr Ferrars. My youngest is not to be found this morning. She is a little shy of strangers at present.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naturally. I am also shy of strangers and I have nothing like her excuse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dangerous) How do you like your view, Mr Ferrars?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: glances at her warningly but EDWARD replies with careful consideration.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Very much. Your stables are very handsome and beautifully kept, Mrs Dashwood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stables! Edward--your windows overlook the lake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An oversight, Fanny, led me to the wrong room. I have rectified the situation and am happily settled in the guest quarters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and ELINOR look at each other in surprise. FANNY looks furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles warmly at EDWARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on ELINOR. She is impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is walking with EDWARD, who looks at the pictures with interest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They are all exceedingly spoilt, I find. Miss Margaret spends all her time up trees and under furniture and I have barely had a civil word from Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dear Fanny, they have just lost their father their lives will never be the same again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is no excuse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leads EDWARD in. She sniffs with distaste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they speak, EDWARD notices a large atlas retreating apparently all by itself across the floor. Someone is obviously under the table, pulling it out of sight. He registers it and immediately moves in such a way as to shield it from FANNY. He turns back, searching for something to divert her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a stifled wail from under the table, which EDWARD covers with a cough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he ushers FANNY out, flicking a quick glance over his shoulder at the fugitive's foot.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have never liked the smell of books.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh? No. The dust, perhaps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hear you have great plans for the walnut grove.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yes! I shall have it pulled down to make room for a Grecian temple.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How picturesque. Will you show me the site?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and MARIANNE are sitting round a table with a pile of letters. ELINOR is handing one back to her mother.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Too expensive. We do not need four bedrooms, we can share.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This one, then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reads the letter quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a knock on the door. Hesitantly, EDWARD appears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne, we have only five hundred pounds a year. I will send out more inquiries today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pardon my intrusion, but I believe I have found what you are looking for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and MRS DASHWOOD are puzzled by his elliptical manner but ELINOR immediately understands and rises, in smiling relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is standing outside keeping a discreet lookout. The door is half open and he can hear ELINOR trying to coax MARGARET out. FANNY walks by with a BUTLER to whom she is giving instructions. EDWARD pretends to examine the mouldings and she passes on unsuspecting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More silence. EDWARD thinks hard. He makes a decision.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Won't you come out, dearest? We haven't seen you all day. Mamma is very concerned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks in loudly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Miss Dashwood! Excuse me I was wondering do you by any chance have such a thing as a reliable atlas?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks up at him in astonishment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I believe so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excellent. I wish to check the position of the Nile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: appears to be utterly sincere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From under the table we hear a snort. ELINOR looks at him in realisation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are having such a good time that it is rather a pity the game is stopped by the appearance from under the table of MARGARET who reveals herself to be a disheveled girl of eleven. She hauls the atlas up and plonks it in front of EDWARD.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My sister says it is in South America.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! No, no indeed. She is quite wrong. For I believe it is in--in Belgium.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Belgium? Surely not. You must be thinking of the Volga.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (from under the table) The Volga?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. The Volga, which, as you know, starts in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vladivostok, and ends in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: St Albans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed. Where the coffee beans come from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The source of the Nile is in Abyssinia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it? Good heavens. How do you do. Edward Ferrars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret Dashwood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shakes MARGARET's hand solemnly and looks over her head at ELINOR. They smile at each other, a connection made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is reading a newspaper. MRS DASHWOOD sits across from FANNY, who thumbs through a fashion-plate magazine. ELINOR is at a desk by the window writing a letter we see the words 'of course we should like to leave as soon as possible'. Suddenly she hears a commotion outside. MARGARET runs past the window brandishing a stick. EDWARD follows, and proceeds to teach her the first principles of sword-fighting. They feint and parry, EDWARD serious and without a hint of condescension, MARGARET concentrating furiously. EDWARD suddenly turns, as though feeling ELINOR's gaze. She smiles but looks away quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes into the doorway and sees ELINOR who is listening to MARIANNE playing a concerto. ELINOR stands in a graceful, rather sad attitude, her back to us. Suddenly she senses EDWARD behind her and turns. He is about to turn away, embarrassed to have been caught admiring her, when he sees she has been weeping. Hastily she tries to dry her eyes. He comes forward and offers her a handkerchief, which she takes with a grateful smile. We notice his monogram in the corner: ECF.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (apologetic) That was my father's favourite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods kindly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They start to walk out of shot, still talking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you so much for your help with Margaret, Mr Ferrars. She is a changed girl since your arrival.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not at all. I enjoy her company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Has she shown you her tree-house?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet. Would you do me the honour, Miss Dashwood? It is very fine out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret has always wanted to travel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. She is heading an expedition to China shortly. I am to go as her servant but only on the understanding that I will be very badly treated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What will your duties be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sword-fighting, administering rum and swabbing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tilts up to find MRS DASHWOOD on the middle landing of the staircase, smiling down at them. CAM tilts up yet further to find FANNY on the landing above, watching EDWARD and ELINOR with a face like a prune.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and ELINOR are still talking as they walk arm in arm in the late afternoon sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His tone is light but there is an underlying bitterness to it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All I want--all I have ever wanted is the quiet of a private life but my mother is determined to see me distinguished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She hardly knows. Any fine figure will suit a great orator, a leading politician, even a barrister would serve, but only on the condition that I drive my own barouche and dine in the first circles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what do you wish for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I always preferred the church, but that is not smart enough for my mother she prefers the army, but that is a great deal too smart for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you stay in London?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate London. No peace. A country living is my ideal a small parish where I might do some good, keep chickens and give very short sermons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and ELINOR are on horseback. The atmosphere is intimate, the quality of the conversation rooted now in their affections.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You talk of feeling idle and useless imagine how that is compounded when one has no choice and no hope whatsoever of any occupation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods and smiles at the irony of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her slightly shocked but enjoying her boldness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ride on in silence for a moment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Our circumstances are therefore precisely the same.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Except that you will inherit your fortune.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We cannot even earn ours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps Margaret is right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Piracy is our only option.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is swabbing exactly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dinner is over. JOHN and FANNY are examining plans of the Norland estate, looking for somewhere to build a hermitage. EDWARD is reading out loud. ELINOR embroiders and listens. MRS DASHWOOD and MARIANNE make up the rest of the audience, the latter in a state of high impatience.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No voice divine the storm allayed No light propitious shone, When snatched from all effectual aid, We perished each alone: But I beneath a rougher sea, And whelmed in deeper gulfs than he.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: jumps up and goes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes the book from him and reads the stanza with passionate brio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rather mortified, EDWARD starts again, but not before receiving a sympathetic look from ELINOR which seems to comfort him a little.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, Edward! Listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you not feel his despair? Try again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is ruminating sadly. MARIANNE rushes in holding a letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DASHWOODS are returning home. A row is in progress.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Margaret) As for you, you have no right, no right at all, to parade your ignorant assumptions--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They are not assumptions. You told me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stares at MARIANNE. MARIANNE colours and attacks MARGARET again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A heated pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I told you nothing--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll meet him when he comes, anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is not the point. You do not speak of such things before strangers--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But everyone else was--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs Jennings is not everyone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like her! She talks about things. We never talk about things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hush, please, now that is enough, Margaret. If you cannot think of anything appropriate to say, you will please restrict your remarks to the weather.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like Colonel Brandon too. He's been to places.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the background, SIR JOHN, ELINOR and MRS JENNINGS pack the remains of a picnic into a basket. MRS DASHWOOD and MARGARET examine a foxhole. In the foreground, MARIANNE is cutting bulrushes for basketwork. Her knife is blunt and she saws impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: materialises at her side and wordlessly offers her his hunting knife. Oddly nervous, MARIANNE takes it. She turns back to the rushes and cuts them with ease. The COLONEL's gaze follows her movements as if held by a magnet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and BRANDON are cleaning their guns in companionable silence--a habit left over from army days. SIR JOHN eyes BRANDON roguishly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know what they're saying, of course...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The word is that you have developed a taste for--certain company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stays resolutely silent. SIR JOHN is emboldened.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And why not, say I. A man like you-- in his prime--she'd be a most fortunate young lady--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: cuts across him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne Dashwood would no more think of me than she would of you, John.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Brandon, my boy, do not think of yourself so meanly--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And all the better for her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: subsides. BRANDON is clearly as angry with himself as he is with SIR JOHN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: strides along in hunting gear, a gun slung under one arm, his dog trotting behind him with a duck clamped between its jaws. The bulrushes catch his eye and he slows, then stops. He stands for a moment deep in thought. Then he takes his hunting knife, cuts one and walks off contemplatively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An outdoor luncheon is in progress. COLONEL BRANDON is talking to MRS DASHWOOD. Occasionally he looks over towards MARIANNE, who is playing bilboquet with SIR JOHN and MARGARET. MRS JENNINGS nudges ELINOR hard and gestures to BRANDON.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (stage whisper) Besotted! Excellent match, for he is rich and she is handsome.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long have you known the Colonel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Lord bless you, as long as ever I have been here, and I came fifteen years back. His estate at Delaford is but four miles hence and he and John are very thick. He has no wife or children of his own, for--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lowers her voice to a stentorian whisper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --he has a tragic history. He loved a girl once--twenty years ago now--a ward to his family, but they were not permitted to marry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is intrigued.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: On what grounds?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Money. Eliza was poor. When the father discovered their amour, she was flung out of the house and he packed off into the army. I believe he would have done himself a harm if not for John...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What became of the lady?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, she was passed from man to man-- disappeared from all good society. When Brandon got back from India he searched for heaven knows how long, only to find her dying in a poor house. You have seen how it has affected him. Once I thought my daughter Charlotte might have cheered him up, but she is much better off where she is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is silent with amazement at this unexpected history.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look at him now, though. So attentive. I shall try an experiment on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, please, dear Mrs Jennings, leave the poor Colonel alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, it is just the thing--all suitors need a little help, my dear
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: winks at ELINOR and rubs her hands as though about to perform a magic trick.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (trillingly) Colonel Brandon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He indicates MARIANNE, who smiles absently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have not heard you play for us of late!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the simple reason that you have a far superior musician here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps you did not know, Miss Marianne, that our dear Brandon shares your passion for music and plays the piano forte very well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at BRANDON in some surprise.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Play us a duet!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at MRS JENNINGS warningly but she ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her tone is so knowing that MARIANNE frowns uncomfortably.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll trow you know quite as many melancholy tunes as Miss Marianne!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come! Let us see you both side by side!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rises impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves away. MRS JENNINGS chuckles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I do not know any duets. Forgive me, Colonel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The DASHWOODS returning. MARIANNE is taking her bonnet off so furiously that she simply gets the knot tighter and tighter. Despite them selves, ELINOR and MRS DASHWOOD are amused.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Are we never to have a moment's peace? The rent here may be low but I think we have it on very hard terms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs Jennings is a wealthy woman with a married daughter--she has nothing to do but marry off everyone else's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pokes her head out from the dining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all crowd into the dining room to find a large package on the table, which MARGARET is permitted to open. In the meantime ELINOR comes to the rescue with the bonnet and MARIANNE stands shifting like a spirited mare as ELINOR patiently unravels the knot.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's a parcel arrived for you, Miss Dashwood!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A parcel!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is too ridiculous! When is a man to be safe from such wit if age and infirmity do not protect him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Infirmity!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If Colonel Brandon is infirm, then I am at death's door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is a miracle your life has extended this far...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you not hear him complain of a rheumatism in his shoulder?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A slight ache' I believe was his phrase...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles and ELINOR laughs at her. Then MARGARET opens the parcel to reveal--her atlas. The atmosphere alters immediately as MRS DASHWOOD and MARIANNE look at ELINOR in consternation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a letter on top of the atlas. CLOSE on the address 'To the Dashwoods'. MRS DASHWOOD picks it up, looks at ELINOR, and opens
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A silence greets this brief epistle. ELINOR struggles to contain her bitter disappointment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But Edward said he would bring it himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Dear Mrs Dashwood, Miss Dashwood, Miss Marianne and Captain Margaret-- it gives me great pleasure to restore this atlas to its rightful owner. Alas, business in London does not permit me to accompany it, although this is likely to hurt me far more than it hurts you. For the present my memories of your kindness must be enough to sustain me, and I remain your devoted servant always. E. C. Ferrars.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But why hasn't he come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says he is busy, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said he'd come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is genuinely upset. ELINOR quietly hangs up MARIANNE's bonnet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why hasn't he come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks beseechingly at MARIANNE, who nods and grasps MARGARET's hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I am taking you for a walk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! I've been a walk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You need another.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is going to rain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shoves her bonnet back on and drags MARGARET out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the front door slam behind them. There is a short silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She approaches ELINOR.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is not going to rain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You always say that and then it always does.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I fear Mrs Jennings is a bad influence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must miss him, Elinor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks very directly at her mother.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are not engaged, Mamma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he loves you, dearest, of that I am certain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks down. She speaks slowly, choosing her words with care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She clears her throat, rises determinedly, picks up the accounts book and opens it. MRS DASHWOOD is silenced.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I am by no means assured of his regard for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Elinor!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But even were he to feel such a... preference, I think we should be foolish to assume that there would not be many obstacles to his choosing a woman of no rank who cannot afford to buy sugar...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But Elinor--your heart must tell you--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In such a situation, Mamma, it is perhaps better to use one's head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks very briskly, dragging an unwilling MARGARET behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has started to rain. Mists are gathering around the two figures walking against the wind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is there any felicity in the world superior to this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you it would rain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look! There is some blue sky! Let us chase it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not supposed to run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs off down the hill into the heart of the mist. MARGARET stumbles after her, grumbling. We follow MARIANNE in her headlong descent and suddenly, dramatically, she trips and sprawls to the ground, letting out a sharp cry of pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to get up, but the pain in her ankle is too great. She sinks back to the ground. MARGARET is very alarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mists have thickened. They can no longer see where they are. Despite her rising fear, MARGARET squares her shoulders bravely and tries to sense the direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She dashes off. As she goes into the mist we hear the thunder of hooves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret, run home and fetch help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it is this way. I will run as fast as I can, Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Margaret's terrified expression. They seem to be coming from all around. She wheels and turns and then--Crash! Through the mist breaks a huge white horse. Astride sits an Adonis in hunting gear. MARGARET squeals. The horse rears. Its rider controls it and slides off. He rushes to MARIANNE's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He indicates her leg. Decorous, perhaps faintly impish.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you hurt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (transfixed) Only my ankle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I have your permission to--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --ascertain if there are any breaks?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods speechlessly. With great delicacy, he feels her ankle. MARGARET's eyes are out on chapel-hooks. MARIANNE almost swoons with embarrassment and excitement mixed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is not broken. Now, can you put your arm about my neck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: does not need any encouragement. He lifts her effortlessly and calls to his horse: 'Bedivere!' It trots obediently forward. The STRANGER smiles down at MARIANNE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Allow me to escort you home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rain is thudding against the window from which MRS DASHWOOD turns, looking very worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we can see she is trying to conceal her anxiety from her mother. There are noises in the hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne was sure it would not rain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which invariably means it will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At last!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs into the room dripping wet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She fell over! She fell down--and he's carrying her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and ELINOR rush to the front door. They see the STRANGER carrying MARIANNE up the garden path, his scarlet coat staining the monochrome rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STRANGER reaches the door. This is no time for introductions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move into the parlour.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In here, sir--this way. Margaret, open the door wider. Please, sir, lay her here. Marianne, are you in pain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is carried in, surrounded by ELINOR, MRS DASHWOOD and MARGARET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STRANGER deposits MARIANNE on the sofa. They look straight into each other's eyes. Electric.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is a twisted ankle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do not be alarmed, Mamma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can assure you it is not serious. I took the liberty of feeling the bone and it is perfectly sound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: raises her eyebrows at MARIANNE, who blushes to her roots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to MARIANNE and smiles. She smiles back gloriously. He bows, and sweeps out of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, I cannot even begin to thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please do not think of it. I'm honoured of be of service.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you not be seated?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pray excuse me--I have no desire to leave a water mark! But permit me to call tomorrow afternoon and inquire after the patient?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We shall look forward to it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hissing) His name! His name!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: silences her with a gesture and follows him out with all the solicitous charm she can command while MARGARET pokes her head around the door to watch. ELINOR is removing MARIANNE's boot and trying not to laugh at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls out after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STRANGER mounts Bedivere and turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he gallops off into the mist--we almost expect Bedivere to sprout wings. CLOSE on MRS DASHWOOD's excited expression.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Please tell us to whom we are so much obliged?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John Willoughby of Allenham--your servant, ma'am!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs back into the parlour, jittering with excitement and anxiety.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr John Willoughby of Allenham!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What an impressive gentleman!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He lifted me as if I weighed no more than a dried leaf!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is he human?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hits ELINOR. MRS DASHWOOD tends to her ankle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From below stairs we can hear MARGARET wailing Wait for me!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me if I hurt you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (regarding Marianne's ecstatic expression) She feels no pain, Mamma. Margaret, ask Betsy to make up a cold compress, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (leaving reluctantly) Did you see him? He expressed himself well, did he not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With great decorum and honour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And spirit and wit and feeling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And economy--ten words at most.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And he is to come tomorrow!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must change, Marianne--you will catch a cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What care I for colds when there is such a man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will care very much when your nose swells up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are right. Help me, Elinor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: comes back with the bandages.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What has happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have decided to give you to the Gypsies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and MARIANNE go upstairs. MARGARET whispers to MRS DASHWOOD.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Will they be married before Edward and Elinor, do you think, Mamma?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret, you are worse than Mrs Jennings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The rain has cleared. SIR JOHN's horse munches grass contentedly by the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Mr Willoughby is well worth catching, Miss Dashwood--Miss Marianne must not expect to have all the men to herself!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The DASHWOODS are having a frustrating time winkling information about WILLOUGHBY out of SIR JOHN, who is in turn only anxious to protect BRANDON's interest. MARIANNE has her bandaged foot up on the sofa and is fast losing patience.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But what do you know of Mr Willoughby, Sir John?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Decent shot--and there is not a bolder rider in all England.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But what is he like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are his tastes? His passions? His pursuits?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mystified) Well, he has the nicest little bitch of a pointer--was she out with him yesterday?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gives up. MRS DASHWOOD takes over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now they are getting somewhere. MARIANNE is about to ask another question when they hear a horse galloping up. Everyone is electrified. MARGARET runs to the window and turns back in disappointment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where is Allenham, Sir John?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice little estate three miles east. He is to inherit it from an elderly relative--Lady Allen is her name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is Colonel Brandon. I shall go outside and keep watch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs out of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You are all on the lookout for Willoughby, eh? Dear me, poor Brandon. You will none of you think of him now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is admitted by BETSY. He is carrying a large bunch of hothouse flowers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands MARIANNE the flowers with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rather absently hands the flowers to ELINOR, who goes for a vase. SIR JOHN gestures at BRANDON with bluff insensitivity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BRANDON's light tone betrays no emotion. ELINOR comes back in with the flowers and puts them on the table next to MARIANNE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly MARGARET runs in screaming 'Marianne's preserver!' at the top of her voice. Everyone starts to move at once. MARGARET is silenced. BRANDON looks at MARIANNE, whose incandescent expression makes her feelings all too clear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How is the invalid?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you so much, Colonel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Marianne, I cannot see why you should set your cap at Mr Willoughby when you have already made such a splendid conquest!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have no intention of 'setting my cap' at anyone, Sir John!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Willoughby--Lady Allen's nephew?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, he visits every year for he is to inherit Allenham--and he has a very pretty estate of his own, Miss Dashwood, Combe Magna in Somerset. If I were you, I would not give him up to my younger sister in spite of all this tumbling down hills.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here is the man himself. Come, Brandon-- we know when we are not wanted. Let us leave him to the ladies!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne! Sir John and the Colonel are leaving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks up, suddenly self-conscious.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, Colonel. Thank you for the flowers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sees them out. We hear WILLOUGHBY's voice outside. CLOSE on MARIANNE's radiant anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is shaking hands with COLONEL BRANDON and SIR JOHN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you do, Colonel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How does he do? How do you do, more like. Go on in, they're waiting for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at WILLOUGHBY for a moment. He bows. WILLOUGHBY bows. Then BRANDON and SIR JOHN exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads in WILLOUGHBY. MRS DASHWOOD greets him with outstretched arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He suddenly produces a bunch of wild flowers from behind his back and offers them to MARIANNE with a courtly, humorous bow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Willoughby! What a pleasure to see you again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The pleasure is all mine, I can asstire you. I trust Miss Marianne has not caught cold?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have found out my name!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. The neighbourhood is crawling with my spies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And since you cannot venture out to nature, nature must be brought to you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How beautiful. These are not from the hothouse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sees BRANDON's flowers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ah! I see mine is not the first offering, nor the most elegant. I am afraid I obtained these from an obliging field.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I have always preferred wild flowers!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suspected as much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: takes the delicate flowers from WILLOUGHBY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is merry, spirited, voluble--a breath of fresh air. ELINOR brings back WILLOUGHBY's flowers and places them next to BRANDON's on the side table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She indicates a chair but WILLOUGHBY sees a book lying on MARIANNE's footstool, picks it up and--to her great delight-- sits down on the stool at her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone answers at once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a general question but MARIANNE gaily commandeers it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I will put these in water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our gratitude, Mr Willoughby, is beyond expression--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it is I who am grateful. I have often passed this cottage and grieved for its lonely state--and then the first news I had from Lady Allen when I arrived was that it was taken. I felt a peculiar interest in the event which nothing can account for but my present delight in meeting you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

In the distance a tavern belches forth drunken REVELLERS who sway and reel into the night. A hooded HORSEMAN pulls up his exhausted steed at the entrance to a slum. He dismounts and looks up at one of the windows. The rags hanging there twitch as if someone is watching for him. He strides inside.

direction.raw_text: The PALMERS, MRS JENNINGS, JOHN, FANNY, LUCY, ELINOR and MARIANNE are walking through the arcade. location: GRAND CRESCENT LEADING TO BALLROOM ENTRANCE
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: The great ballroom is crammed with GUESTS all determined to enjoy themselves despite the considerable inconveniences caused by noise, heat and overcrowding. MEN are sweating profusely, WOMEN dab their brows, rack punch is being swallowed by the gallon, flirting is conducted at fever pitch and all conversation is inordinately loud. Only the DANCERS have a modicum of space in which to perform their mincing steps. MRS JENNINGS and her brood bump into the PALMERS.

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
