dialogue.raw_text: I am excessively fond of a cottage. If I had any money to spare, I should build one myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stiff) How do you do, Miss Dashwood?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: does not know quite how to respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks about for MARIANNE, instinctively wanting to keep her away from WILLOUGHBY.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I am well, thank you, Mr Willoughby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is your--family?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cold) We are all extremely well, Mr Willoughby--thank you for your kind inquiry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is shamed into silence. Then he sees MARIANNE. At the same moment the music pauses. MARIANNE looks up. In the brief moment of relative quiet, her great cry rings across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone turns to look as MARIANNE rushes towards him with both arms outstretched, her face luminous with joy. As the noise of the room builds again and PEOPLE change their partners, we are aware that many are surreptitiously watching. MARIANNE reaches him but WILLOUGHBY stands with his arms frozen at his side. MARIANNE gives a little confused laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Willoughby!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good God, Willoughby! Will you nor shake hands with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks extremely uncomfortable and glances towards a group of very smart PEOPLE who are watching him closely. Central to this group is a SOPHISTICATED WOMAN who frowns at him proprietorially.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shakes MARIANNE's hand briefly. Behind her, MRS JENNINGS is giving an animated commentary to FANNY and JOHN, while LUCY whispers in ROBERT's ear as they go past to join the set.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (strangled) How do you do, Miss Marianne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willoughby, what is the matter? Why have you not come to see me? Were you not in London? Have you nor received my letters?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is sweating with tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bows, white to the teeth, and walks away to join the SOPHISTICATED WOMAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is drawn away by his PARTY, some of whom look back at MARIANNE with a mixture of curiosity and condescension. MARIANNE almost sinks to her knees. ELINOR supports her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I had the pleasure of receiving the information which you were so good as to send me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (piteously) For heaven's sake, Willoughby, tell me what is wrong!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you--I am most obliged. If you will excuse me, I must return to my party.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willoughby!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne! Come away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go to him, Elinor--force him to come to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has come up, full of concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They almost have to drag MARIANNE away. MRS JENNINGS turns back to the DASHWOOD party. FANNY and JOHN have practically imploded with embarrassment and are distancing themselves as much as possible from the source. LUCY and ROBERT are dancing nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rushes off to follow MARIANNE and ELINOR. We stay for a moment with LUCY and ROBERT who have left the set.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dearest, do not betray what you feel to everyone present! This is not the place for explanations--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come along, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you come, Lucy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, are we leaving so soon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I might be so bold, Mrs Jennings, it would be our pleasure to escort your young charge home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How very kind!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is very handsome--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She actually sent him messages during the night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rises to show the DASHWOODS exiting past the whispering, sneering faces of the CROWD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits scribbling a letter at the desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne, please tell me--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do not ask me questions!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have no confidence in me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This reproach from you! You, who confide in no one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have nothing to tell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nor I. We have neither of us anything to tell. I because I conceal nothing and you because you communicate nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A silent breakfast. MARIANNE is red-eyed from crying and limp from lack of sleep. MRS JENNINGS is dressed to go out, pulling on her gloves and bustling as usual. PIGEON enters with a letter on a salver. He offers it to MARIANNE. She seizes it and runs out of the room. MRS JENNINGS chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leaves and ELINOR finds herself alone with LUCY, who loses no time in sharing her new-found happiness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There now! Lovers' quarrels are swift to heal! That letter will do the trick, mark my word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I must be off. I hope he won't keep her waiting much longer, Miss Dashwood. It hurts to see her looking so forlorn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What a welcome I had from Edward's family, Miss Dashwood--I am surprised you never told me what an agreeable woman your sister-in-law is! And Mr Robert--all so affable!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is perhaps fortunate that none of them knows of your engagement. Excuse me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rises and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: finds MARIANNE sitting on the edge of the bed. She does not acknowledge ELINOR but merely lifts the letter and reads out, with deadly calm:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: 'My dear Madam--I am quite at a loss to discover in what point I could be so unfortunate as to offend you. My esteem for your family is very sincere but if I have given rise to a belief of more than I felt or meant to express, I shall reproach myself for not having been more guarded. My affections have long been engaged elsewhere and it is with great regret that I return your letters and the lock of hair which you so obligingly bestowed upon me. I am etc. John Willoughby.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gives a great howl of pain and flings herself across the bed as though in physical agony.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne, oh, Marianne--it is better to know at once what his intentions are. Dearest, think of what you would have felt if your engagement had carried on for months and months before he chose to put an end to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are not engaged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you wrote to him! I thought then that he must have left you with some kind of understanding?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No--he is not so unworthy as you think him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not so unworthy! Did he tell you that he loved you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. No--never absolutely. It was every day implied, but never declared. Sometimes I thought it had been, but it never was. He has broken no vow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has broken faith with all of us, he made us all believe he loved you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He did! He did--he loved me as I loved him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bursts through the door in her hat and coat, panting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I had to come straight up--how are you, Miss Marianne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: begins to sob uncontrollably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes round the bed to comfort MARIANNE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Poor thing! She looks very bad. No wonder, Miss Dashwood, for it is but too true. I was told here in the street by Miss Morton, who is a great friend: he is to be married at the end of the month--to a Miss Grey with fifty thousand pounds. Well, said I, if 'tis true, then he is a good-for-nothing who has used my young friend abominably ill, and I wish with all my soul that his wife may plague his heart out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he is not the only young man worth having, my dear, and with your pretty face you will never want for admirers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sobs even harder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, me! She had better have her cry out and have done with it. I will go and look out something to tempt her-- does she care for olives?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leaves. MARIANNE seizes the letter again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot believe his nature capable of such cruelty!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne, there is no excuse for him-- this is his hand--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it cannot be his heart! Oh, Mamma! I want Mamma! Elinor, please take me home! Cannot we go tomorrow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is no one to take us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cannot we hire a carriage?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have no money--and indeed we owe Mrs Jennings more courtesy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All she wants is gossip and she only likes me because I supply it! Oh, God! I cannot endure to stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will find a way. I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and ROBERT are drinking chocolate together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He trails off. FANNY exchanges an alarmed glance with ROBERT. She thinks fast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Apparently they never were engaged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Grey has fifty thousand pounds. Marianne is virtually penniless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She cannot have expected him to go through with it. But I feel for Marianne--she will lose her bloom and end a spinster like Elinor. I think, my dear, we might consider having them to stay with us for a few days--we are, after all, family, and my father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My love, I would ask them with all my heart, but I have already asked Miss Steele for a visit and we cannot deprive Mrs Jennings of all her company at once. We can invite your sisters some other year, you know, and Miss Steele will profit far more from your generosity--poor girl!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is very thoughtful, Fanny. We shall ask Elinor and Marianne next year, then... Certainly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: s carriage stands outside. A livened FOOTMAN opens the door and LUCY steps out brandishing a new muff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits alone on the bed. Around her lie her notes to Willoughby, her lock of hair and the pocket sonnets. In her hands is the creased and tear-stained letter from Willoughby which she is examining over and over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is seated at a desk writing a letter. There is a sudden rap at the front door. Footsteps are heard and as she turns, the maid enters with COLONEL BRANDON. ELINOR rises to greet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bows. ELINOR is on edge. BRANDON looks haggard with concern.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for coming, Colonel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How does your sister?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I must get her home as quickly as possible. The Palmers can take us as far as Cleveland, which is but a day from Barton--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then permit me to accompany you and take you straight on from Cleveland to Barton myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: takes his hands gratefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a moment BRANDON nods. He seems unable to remain still or calm and finds it difficult to begin speaking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I confess that is precisely what I had hoped for. Marianne suffers cruelly, and what pains me most is how hard she tries to justify Mr Willoughby. But you know her disposition.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps I--my regard for you all-- Miss Dashwood, will you allow me to prove it by relating some circumstances which nothing but an earnest desire of being useful--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have something to tell me of Mr Willoughby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) When I quitted Barton last--but I must go further back. A short account of myself will be necessary. No doubt... no doubt Mrs Jennings has apprised you of certain events in my past--the sad outcome of my connection with a young woman named Eliza.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is strong stuff. ELINOR's concern deepens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paces about, barely able to conceal his distress.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is not commonly known is that twenty years ago, Eliza bore an illegitimate child. The father, whoever he was, abandoned them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As she lay dying, she begged me to look after the child. Eliza died in my arms, broken, wasted away--ah! Miss Dashwood, such a subject-- untouched for so many years--it is dangerous...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had failed Eliza in every other way--I could not refuse her now. I took the child--Beth is her name-- and placed her with a family where I could be sure she would be well looked after. I saw her whenever I could. I saw that she was headstrong like her mother--and, God forgive me, I indulged her, I allowed her too much freedom. Almost a year ago, she disappeared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Disappeared!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I instigated a search but for eight months I was left to imagine the worst. At last, on the day of the Delaford picnic, I received the first news her. She was with child... and the blackguard who had--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stops and looks straight at ELINOR.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good God. Do you mean--Willoughby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods. ELINOR drops into a chair, utterly shocked.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Before I could return to confront him, Lady Allen learned of his behaviour and turned him from the house. He beat a hasty retreat to London--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes! He left us that morning, without any explanation!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lady Allen had annulled his legacy. He was left with next to nothing, and in danger of losing all that remained to his debtors--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --and so abandoned Marianne for Miss Grey and her fifty thousand pounds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is silent. ELINOR is breathless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Have you seen Mr Willoughby since you learned...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) We met by appointment, he to defend, I to punish his conduct.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stares at him, aghast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We returned unwounded, so the meeting never got abroad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods and is silent for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is Beth still in town?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She has chosen to go into the country for her confinement. Such has been the unhappy resemblance between the fate of mother and daughter, and so imperfectly have I discharged my trust.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would not have burdened you, Miss Dashwood, had I not from my heart believed it might, in time, lessen your sister's regrets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: moves to the door and then stops. He turns to her and speaks with effort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up at BRANDON. Silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have described Mr Willoughby as the worst of libertines--but I have since learned from Lady Allen that he did mean to propose that day. Therefore I cannot deny that his intentions towards Marianne were honourable, and I feel certain he would have married her, had it not been for--for the money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is sitting on the bed staring into space. ELINOR is kneeling by her, holding her hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dearest, was I right to tell you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever his past actions, whatever his present course, at least you may be certain that he loved you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But not enough. Not enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sits alone with her head in her hands. Suddenly MRS JENNINGS hustles in looking pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is followed in by LUCY. MRS JENNINGS leaves, busy as ever. LUCY plants an expression of ghastly concern on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAID comes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a tiny frozen silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here is someone to cheer you up, Miss Dashwood!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is your dear sister, Miss Dashwood? Poor thing! I must say, I do not know what I should do if a man treated me with so little respect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you are enjoying your stay with John and Fanny, Miss Steele?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was never so happy in my entire life, Miss Dashwood! I do believe your sister-in-law has taken quite a fancy to me. I had to come and tell you--for you cannot imagine what has happened!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I cannot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yesterday I was introduced to Edward's mother!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And she was a vast deal more than civil. I have not yet seen Edward but now I feel sure to very soon--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a Mr Edward Ferrars to see you, Miss Dashwood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do ask him to come up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: quite involuntarily sits down and then stands up again. EDWARD is admitted, looking both anxious and eager. As LUCY is sitting in the window seat, at first he sees only ELINOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But ELINOR cuts him off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Dashwood, how can I--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Ferrars, what a pleasure to see you. You... know Miss Steele, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns slowly and encounters LUCY's glassy smile. He all but blanches. Then bows, and clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you do, Miss Steele.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am well, thank you, Mr Ferrars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has no notion of what to do or say. He swallows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LUCY's eyes are sharp as broken glass. EDWARD remains on his feet, looking helplessly from one woman to the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is precisely what EDWARD had thought. He tries to smile but his facial muscles won't work. ELINOR decides to fetch help.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do sit down, Mr Ferrars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must be surprised to find me here, Mr Ferrars! I expect you thought I was at your sister's house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me call Marianne, Mr Ferrars. She would be most disappointed to miss you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: goes to the door, thankful to escape, but MARIANNE prevents her by walking in at that moment. Despite her anguish, she is very pleased to see EDWARD and embraces him warmly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Edward! I heard your voice! At last you have found us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is shocked by her appearance and momentarily forgets his own confusion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me, Marianne, my visit is shamefully overdue. You are pale. I hope you have not been unwell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, don't think of me--Elinor is well, you see, that must be enough for both of us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gestures to ELINOR encouragingly but EDWARD seems unable to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, MARIANNE endeavours to ignite the lovers. ELINOR tries to silence MARIANNE with her eyes but to no avail. MARIANNE puts their coolness down to the presence of LUCY, at whom she glances with a none too friendly air.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you like London, Marianne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not at all. The sight of you is all the pleasure it has afforded, is that not so, Elinor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why have you taken so long to come and see us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have been much engaged elsewhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Engaged elsewhere! But what was that when there were such friends to be met?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps, Miss Marianne, you think young men never honour their engagements, little or great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is appalled by this remark but MARIANNE does not notice it and turns back to LUCY earnestly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, indeed--for Edward is the most fearful of giving pain and the most incapable of being selfish of anyone I ever saw.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: makes an uncomfortable noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now EDWARD can stand it no longer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Edward, will you not sit? Elinor, help me to persuade him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me but I must take my leave--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you are only just arrived!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rises, desperate for them both to go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You must excuse me, I have a commission to attend to for Fanny--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: jumps in like a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is an extremely awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes hands with ELINOR and with MARIANNE, who is silent with dismay. LUCY takes EDWARD's arm and looks up at him proprietorially. After a stiff bow and a muttered farewell from EDWARD, they leave. MARIANNE looks at her sister in astonishment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In that case perhaps you might escort me back to your sister's house, Mr Ferrars?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would be honoured. Goodbye, Miss Dashwood, Miss Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why did you not urge him to stay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He must have had his reasons for going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His reason was no doubt your coldness. If I were Edward I would assume you did not care for me at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A tranquil afternoon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sitting with FANNY, who is doing some pointless basketwork. LUCY hands FANNY rushes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Poor Miss Marianne looked very badly t'other day. When I think of her, deserted and abandoned, it frightens me to think I shall never marry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nonsense. You will marry far better than either of the Dashwood girls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can that possibly be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have ten times their sense and looks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I have no dowry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are qualities which will always make up for that, and you have them in abundance. It would not surprise me if you were to marry far and away beyond your expectations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish it might be so. There is a young man--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah ha! I am glad to hear of it. Is he of good breeding and fortune?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh both--but his family would certainly oppose the match.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tush! They will allow it as soon as they see you, my dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is a very great secret. I have told no one in the world for fear of discovery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks up, curious to know more.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My dear, I am the soul of discretion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I dared tell...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can assure you I am as silent as the grave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leans forward to whisper in FANNY's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hold a long shot of the house for a moment of silence. Then from inside comes an almost inhumanly loud shriek.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Viper in my bosom!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is trying to drag LUCY out of the house. ROBERT and JOHN are trying to reason with her. FANNY loses her grip and falls backwards. LUCY flings herself into ROBERT's arms. ROBERT falls over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is running as fast as her fat little legs will carry her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pants up the front steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MARIANNE are packing. Their mood is gloomy and uncommunicative. MRS JENNINGS explodes into the room fighting for breath.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, my dears! What a commotion! Mr Edward Ferrars--the very one I used to joke you about, Miss Dashwood-- has been engaged these five years to Lucy Steele!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lets out a gasp. She looks at ELINOR, who nods at her in swift confirmation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leaves the room, still rabbiting on. There is a silence.

dialogue.raw_text: Poor Mr Ferrars! His mother, who by all accounts is very proud, demanded that he break the engagement on pain of disinheritance. But he has refused to break his promise to Lucy. I have had to endure her exultation again and again while knowing myself to be divided from Edward forever. dialogue.raw_text: He would have had a wife he loved but no money--and might soon have learned to rank the demands of his pocket-book far above the demands of his heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: regards MARIANNE admiringly. MARIANNE smiles sadly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If his present regrets are half as painful as mine, he will suffer enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you compare your conduct with his?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I compare it with what it ought to have been. I compare it with yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our situations were very different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My illness has made me consider the past. I saw in my own behaviour nothing but imprudence--and worse. I was insolent and unjust to everyone--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tries to stem the flow but MARIANNE continues.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --but you--you I wronged above all. Only I knew your heart and its sorrows but even then I was never a grain more compassionate. I brought my illness upon myself--I wanted to destroy myself. And had I succeeded, what misery should I have caused you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: embraces her. They stand with their arms round one another in silence for a moment. Then MARIANNE breaks away and speaks with great good humour and energy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I shall mend my ways! I shall no longer worry others nor torture myself. I am determined to enter on a course of serious study---Colonel Brandon has promised me the run of his library and I shall read at least six hours a day. By the end of the year I expect to have improved my learning a very great deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is sitting on the back of a local wagon, holding a basket of food. He jumps off near the cottage and waves a cheery farewell to the DRIVER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the accounts book, covered in blots and crossed-out sums. Pull up to reveal MARIANNE labouring over it. Her sickness has left her slightly short-sighted and she uses a pince-nez that makes her look like an owl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sewing and MRS DASHWOOD is snoozing. MARGARET goes up and looks over MARIANNE's shoulder. She frowns at the spider's web of ink.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You'll go blind if you're not careful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: brings in coals for the fire. MRS DASHWOOD rouses herself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is Thomas back from Exeter, Betsy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, ma'am--he brung back two lovely fillets for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks nervously at ELINOR like a child who has been caught out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Beef is far less expensive in Exeter, and anyway they are for Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: laughs and rolls her eyes to heaven. BETSY turns on her way out to remark:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a stunned silence. Everyone looks at ELINOR.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sixpence a piece, Miss Dashwood. Oh, and he says Mr Ferrars is married, but I suppose you know that, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fetch Thomas to us, Betsy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leaves. They all sit very still. MARGARET is about to talk to ELINOR about it but MARIANNE stops her. THOMAS enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Beg pardon, Miss Dashwood, but they was the cheapest in the market--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was a very good price, Thomas, well done. Would you be so kind as to build up the fire a little?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relieved) Yes, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who told you that Mr Ferrars was married, Thomas?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: builds up the fire as he answers. He tells the story with pleasure.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I seen him myself, ma'am, and his lady too, Miss Lucy Steele as was-- they were stopping in a chaise at the New London Inn. I happened to look up as I passed the chaise and I see it was Miss Steele. So I took off my hat and she inquired after you, ma'am, and all the young ladies, especially Miss Dashwood, and bid me I should give you her and Mr Ferrars's best compliments and service and how they'd be sure to send you a piece of the cake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was Mr Ferrars in the carriage with her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, ma'am--I just seen him leaning back in it, but he did not look up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: screws up her courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she cannot continue. MARIANNE glances at her compassionately and takes over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods and leaves, confused by the silent atmosphere. ELINOR sits for a moment, then gets up and walks out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did Mrs Ferrars seem well?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Miss Marianne--she said how she was vastly contented and, since she was always a very affable young lady, I made free to wish her joy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Thomas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is standing by the gate, looking out. MRS DASHWOOD comes down the path to join her. She links arms with ELINOR and they stand in silence for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your father once told me not to allow you to neglect yourself. Now I find that it is I who have neglected you most.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Mamma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I have. We all have. Marianne is right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am very good at hiding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we must observe you more closely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mamma?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, my darling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is a painful difference between the expectation of an unpleasant event and its final certainty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: squeezes ELINOR's arm tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A horse and cart are jogging along. The cart contains a large object tied down and covered with canvas. The DRIVER whistles tunelessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is standing on the kitchen table while ELINOR and MARIANNE pin a piece of material around the bottom of her skirt to lengthen it. Suddenly there is a commotion upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone runs out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Marianne! Marianne! Come and see what is coming!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and the CARTER are carrying a small piano up the path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They carry the piano into the parlour and to the DASHWOODS' joyful astonishment it fits perfectly. MRS DASHWOOD reads out the letter that has accompanied it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: 'At last I have found a small enough instrument to fir the parlour. I expect to follow it in a day or two, by which time I expect you to have learned the enclosed. Your devoted friend, Christopher Brandon.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hands MARIANNE the letter and a broadsheet song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the same, she looks conscious of the truth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He must like you very much, Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is not just for me! It is for all of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is up her tree. ELINOR is pulling weeds. MRS DASHWOOD is sitting on a stool working on MARGARET's dress and listening to the strains of the new song which MARIANNE is singing in the cottage. All of a sudden, MRS DASHWOOD rises, shielding her eyes with her hand. She walks down to the gate, looking out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The piano stops. MARIANNE comes out and they all gather at the gate to watch for the rider.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here is Colonel Brandon! Marianne!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Their POV of a HORSEMAN in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not think it is the Colonel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly there is a yell from MARGARET's tree.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It must be. He said he would arrive today. You must play him the new song, Marianne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Edward!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: practically throws herself out of the tree onto the grass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The women look at each other in complete consternation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is Edward!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Calm. We must be calm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tense silence reigns. Everyone tries to busy themselves. BETSY enters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr Ferrars for you, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: follows her in, looking white and agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bows formally to each of them, lingering on ELINOR, who is looking firmly at her lap. He looks anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a pause while they all search for an appropriate remark. Finally MARGARET decides to have a go at polite conversation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Edward! What a pleasure to see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs Dashwood. Miss Marianne. Margaret. Miss Dashwood. I hope I find you all well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Edward, we are all very well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have been enjoying very fine weather.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at her incredulously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am glad of it. The... the roads were very dry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: decides to bite the bullet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes her hand somewhat confusedly and accepts her offer of a seat. There is an awful silence. MARIANNE tries to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is another bone-crunching pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (giving him her hand) May I wish you great joy, Edward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you have left Mrs Ferrars well?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tolerably, thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I--But EDWARD cannot seem to find any words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is Mrs Ferrars at the new parish?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks extremely confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He plucks up the courage to look at ELINOR again and is evidently not much comforted by what he sees.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No--my mother is in town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I meant to enquire after Mrs Edward Ferrars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: colours. He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all stare at him in shock.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then you have not heard--the news--I think you mean my brother--you mean Mrs Robert Ferrars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs Robert Ferrars?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has frozen. EDWARD rises and goes to the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I received a letter from Miss Steele--or Mrs Ferrars, I should say-- communicating the... the transfer of her affections to my brother Robert. They were much thrown together in London, I believe, and... and in view of the change in my circumstances, I felt it only fair that Miss Steele be released from our engagement. At any rate, they were married last week and are now in Plymouth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rises suddenly, EDWARD turns and they stand looking at one another.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then you--are not married.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bursts into tears. The shock of this emotional explosion stuns everyone for a second and then MARIANNE makes an executive decision. Wordlessly, she takes MARGARET's hand and leads her and MRS DASHWOOD out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three DASHWOODS come into the garden, still holding hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cannot stop crying. EDWARD comes forward, very slowly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Elinor! I met Lucy when I was very young. Had I had an active profession, I should never have felt such an idle, foolish inclination. At Norland my behaviour was very wrong. But I convinced myself you felt only friendship for me and it was my heart alone that I was risking. I have come with no expectations. Only to profess, now that I am at liberty to do so, that my heart is and always will be yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at him, her face streaked with tears of released emotion, of pain and of happiness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MRS DASHWOOD are stamping about in the garden trying to keep warm. MARGARET has climbed into her tree-house. The branches rustle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's sitting next to her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Margaret, come down!/Is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (scolding) Margaret! Will you stop--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's happening now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marianne!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He's kneeling down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: can't help herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She and MARIANNE look at each other joyfully.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Is he? Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The figures of EDWARD and ELINOR can be seen walking, in deep conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later. The lovers walk slowly, their heads almost touching, their words low and intimate.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your mother, I suppose, will hardly be less angry with Robert for marrying Lucy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The more so since she settled the money upon him so irrevocably--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --no doubt because she had run out of sons to disinherit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her family fluctuates at an alarming rate. Then, in London, when you told me of the Colonel's offer, I became convinced that you wanted me to marry Lucy and that--well, that you and Colonel Brandon...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me and Colonel Brandon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shall not forget attempting to thank him for making it possible for me to marry the woman I did not love while convinced he had designs upon the woman I did--do--love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stops walking. He looks at ELINOR and realises he can stand it no longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes her face in his hands and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Would you--can you--excuse me--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A group of VILLAGE CHILDREN run down the hillside towards the church waving ribbons and dressed in their Sunday best.
